glsa.title: phpMyAdmin: Insecure SQL script installation
glsa.synopsis: phpMyAdmin leaves the SQL install script with insecure permissions, potentially leading to a database compromise.

background.p: phpMyAdmin is a tool written in PHP intended to handle the administration of MySQL databases from a web-browser. phpMyAdmin uses a pma MySQL user to control the linked-tables infrastructure. The SQL install script sets the initial password for the pma user.

description.p: The phpMyAdmin installation process leaves the SQL install script with insecure permissions.

impact.p: A local attacker could exploit this vulnerability to obtain the initial phpMyAdmin password and from there obtain information about databases accessible by phpMyAdmin.

workaround.p: Change the password for the phpMyAdmin MySQL user (pma):
workaround.code: mysql -u root -p SET PASSWORD FOR 'pma'@'localhost' = PASSWORD('MyNewPassword');
